In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution for your problem in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line) # Add the last line after loop
    
    join(lines, "\n")
end
```
You can use this function as follows:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua"
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This will output the string with each word on a new line after 10 characters:

```julia
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet
consectetur adipiscing elit sed do eiusmod tempor
incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua
```
